Paragraph: For ( PCPDTBT ) , which showed absorption in the range 380-900 nm in the AM 1.5 G spectrum , good hole mobility ( 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and a high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 3.2% with PC71BM as the electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCPDTBT: This is a specific material name mentioned in the paragraph. It stands for Poly(3,4-ethylene dioxythiophene):2,6-terthiophene:3'-thienylene:5,5'-bis(3-carbomethoxyphenyl)-2,2'-bithiophene. It is a type of conjugated polymer used as a donor material in organic photovoltaic cells.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: For ( PCPDTBT ) , which showed absorption in the range 380-900 nm in the AM 1.5 G spectrum , good hole mobility ( 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and a high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 3.2% with PC71BM as the electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCPDTBT: This is the name of the specific material (poly(3,4-ethylene dioxythiophene):2,6-(3,5-bis(trifluoromethyl)phenyl)-7,7-dioctylbenzo[c][1,2-b:5,4-b']dithiophene-4,8-dithiophene:2,6-di(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)benzo[1,2-b:5,4-b']dithiophene) mentioned in the paragraph. It is a type of conjugated polymer.
2. AM 1.5 G: This is a reference to the AM1.5G method, which is a computational quantum chemistry method used to predict the electronic properties of organic molecules.
3. good hole mobility: This is a property of the material, specifically its ability to conduct holes (positive charge carriers) efficiently. The range given is 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1.
4. PCE: This stands for power conversion efficiency, which is a measure of how effectively a solar cell converts sunlight into electricity. The value given is 3.2%.
5. PC71BM: This is the name of the electron acceptor material used in conjunction with PCPDTBT in the solar cell.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PCPDTBT: This is a material with good hole mobility in the range of 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 and a high power conversion efficiency (PCE) of 3.2%.
2. hole mobility: This is a property of material PCPDTBT, specifically its ability to conduct holes efficiently.
3. power conversion efficiency (PCE): This is a property of material PCPDTBT, measuring its ability to effectively convert sunlight into electricity.

Paragraph: For ( PCPDTBT ) , which showed absorption in the range 380-900 nm in the AM 1.5 G spectrum , good hole mobility ( 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and a high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 3.2% with PC71BM as the electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCPDTBT: This is a specific material or compound with the given properties. In this context, it can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the value being "PCPDTBT".
2. 380-900 nm: This is a range of wavelengths. In this context, it can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the value being "380-900 nm".
3. 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1: This is a range of hole mobility values. In this context, it can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the value being "0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1".
4. 3.2%: This is the power conversion efficiency value. In this context, it can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the value being "3.2%".
5. PC71BM: This is the electron acceptor material. In this context, it can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the value being "PC71BM".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCPDTBT: This organic semiconductor material has a hole mobility in the range of 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and a power conversion efficiency (PCE) of 3.2% when used with PC71BM as the electron acceptor. The absorption range of PCPDTBT is 380-900 nm in the AM 1.5 G spectrum.

Property Value Entities:
1. 0.01 - 0.1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1: hole mobility of PCPDTBT
2. 3.2%: power conversion efficiency of PCPDTBT
